intro: Ilex metabaptista var. myrsinoides, commonly known as the Mexican holly, is a shrub or small tree native to Mexico. It belongs to the family Aquifoliaceae and is characterized by its evergreen leaves, which are usually glossy and elliptical in shape. The plant produces small, red berries that are an important food source for various birds and wildlife. It typically grows in moist, well-drained soils in shaded to partially sunny environments.
